Posts.Content: My urologist got a questionable reading through the lab he uses. He then sent it to John Hopkins ( Dr. Epstein) I think. Heard he's pretty much the best in the country and that's where I had my surgery. Good luck to you

Posts.Content: Thanks Brock for your reply. I guess it's a pretty normal part of recovery. Just makes me feel better to hear the same experience from another person. Thanks again and good luck with your recovery.
Posts.Title: Bleeding post DaVinci surgery

Posts.Title: Bleeding post DaVinci surgery

Posts.Content: Hello, I want to first thank everyone on this site for sharing their experiences with prostate cancer. I'm 50 years old and just had radical prostatectomy via DaVinci at John Hopkins, performed by Dr Schaeffer. I'm 5 days post op and experiencing blood from my penis, during bowel movements. I'm taking stool softener and have loose bowels, so I'm not straining much. I am a little concerned about this and wondering if anyone had similar experience. Thank you very much 50yo Gleason 6 May 2012, psa 4.1 Nov 2013, psa 6.1 Radical prostatectomy on 3/12/14 Dr Schaeffer, John Hopkins
Posts.Title: Bleeding post DaVinci surgery

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for your reply. Unfortunately I couldn't contact my doctor due to snow storm. I am definitely more reassured after all the candid replies.
